thread.title: March to defend public services
thread.title_full: March to defend public services | Channel - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: March to defend public services
text:
A map of the march route Credit: Google Maps Tomorrow public sector workers will march through St Helier, Jersey, to protest against cuts to public services.
They disagree with the way the States are filling the £145m financial 'black hole'.
£70m is planned to be cut from the public sector wage bill, which could lead to outsourcing among other things.
The cuts to services will see many loyal public servants thrown out of work and public services outsourced, privatised or stopped completely all of which will have a detrimental effect on the whole of Jersey as the unemployment rate rises, service quality declines and off-island companies take money out of the local economy. Increased and new user charges which are little more than stealth taxes, will further compound the transfer of the burden of taxation on to the individual, with the lowest paid the hardest hit.
– Marina Mauger, NASUWT Jersey Secretary The march starts in Howard Davis Park at 10:30am and ends with a rally at People's Park.
Last updated Fri 2 Oct 2015 Politics Jersey
